title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 26 August 2014 - XWiki
content:

08:32 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
08:41 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
08:50 <DarkKnightCZ> has joined #xwiki  
08:53 <DarkKnightCZ> Hi, i have component running in clustered environment which periodically updates certain data, is there any tool that could make it "clustered"? (so it runs only one node, but for example round-robin style)  
09:03 <KermitTheFragger> has joined #xwiki  
09:21 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
09:30 <Inge-> not sure what you are asking  
09:34 <DarkKnightCZ> well, for example part of this component is used for synchronizing user groups and it runs periodically (so for example it runs every 24 hours), if i put this component on all cluster nodes, it will run 3 times instead of one, but if i put this on one node only, it couldn't run at all (that node will fail for example)  
09:36 <DarkKnightCZ> so far i've came up with two ideas -> reusing zookeeper / reusing jgroups (randomize run period and if component receive some custom event it will mark as "finished" and just wait again, if component runs, it fires this custom event)  
09:37 <ClemensR> has joined #xwiki  
09:57 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
10:01 <gdelhumeau> has joined #xwiki  
10:04 <Denis> has quit  
10:05 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
10:13 <DarkKnightCZ> has left #xwiki  
10:23 <Lyes> has joined #xwiki  
10:26 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
10:44 <gdelhumeau> mflorea: vmassol Enygma` : can I restart jenkins?  
10:45 <Enygma`> gdelhumeau: not yet  
10:45 <Enygma`> I`ll do it shortly  
10:45 <gdelhumeau> ok thanks  
10:45 <mflorea> no problem for me  
10:49 <Enygma`> gdelhumeau, mflorea: please see my message from yesterday on skype re the wysiwyg test and headings in flamingo.  
10:49 <Enygma`> (issue with the bold operation on headings)  
10:50 <mflorea> Enygma`: seen it, but I can't help right now  
11:01 <DarkKnightCZ> has joined #xwiki  
11:29 <martin77> has joined #xwiki  
11:30 <martin77> hello, i really hope someone can help me figure this one out: we have 2 (supposedly identical) installations of xwiki enterprise 5.2.1. One of them starts with document mode: IE9 compatibility mode and the other does not.  
11:33 <martin77> any quick win tips that might help me solve this browser/webapplication riddle are very welcome  
11:38 <ClemensR> martin77: if the server are identical, any chance it is a setting in the browser ? I remember IE has some domain-based settings for going into compatibility mode, and if the user sets them, the browser obeys  
11:38 <DarkKnightCZ> martin77: look into templates folder, file htmlheader.vm  
11:39 <martin77> i verified the vm file  
11:41 <martin77> clemensr: im sure ie can/offers to do a lot of wicked stuff, but i need more specific pointer what could possibly cause my browser to switch xwiki into compatibility mode  
11:41 <martin77> for example  
11:41 <DarkKnightCZ> then look into webpage source (ctrl+u in chrome/firefox) and lookup for line that sets the compatibility mode  
11:42 <martin77> thatd be F12 for IE :)  
11:42 <martin77> and you refer to doctype ?  
11:43 <ClemensR> in the head there is  the  <meta http-equiv="X-UA-Compatible" content="IE=edge" />  (or should be)  
11:44 <ClemensR> the user settings are in the "Internet options" ... I always forget whee exactly, if you start looking for them sure you will find them quicker than me  
11:44 <martin77> the metacontent is set to xua compatible and ie=edge  
11:44 <martin77> on both  
11:45 <martin77> that'd mean its not the page that determines the document mode ?  
11:46 <martin77> so with this can we confirm the document not being the culprit ?  
11:46 <ClemensR> I think so. If the user forces IE into compatibility mode, the server cannot prevent that.  
11:46 <martin77> users force nothing :)  
11:47 <martin77> its either a gpo (maybe an old one i dont know it does something with IE (bad docs))  
11:47 <martin77> or something in the xwiki config files  
11:47 <martin77> i cant think of other reasons to explain the difference in our situation  
11:49 <ClemensR> I remember I had a similar problem once, and it was a browser setting: XWIKI-9746  
11:52 <martin77> i compared xwiki cfg, xwiki properties and hibernate cfg  
11:52 <martin77> nothing except the obvious different database, etc  
11:53 <DarkKnightCZ> compare templates, thats where could be the difference (otherwise it's really IE issue)  
11:55 <martin77> ok  
11:55 <martin77> all files on both servers in /templates have original timestamp  
11:56 <martin77> pretty safe to exclude as well  
11:58 <martin77> excluded our internal webproxy  
12:03 <DarkKnightCZ> what about http headers? isn't there x-ua-compatible as well?  
12:03 <martin77> yes it is in both xua compatible  
12:05 <gdelhumeau> martin77: if the <meta> tag is  not enough  
12:05 <gdelhumeau> you should try sending X-UA-Compatible in the HTML header too  
12:07 <gdelhumeau> something like response.setHeader("X-UA-Compatible", "IE=edge")  
12:07 <martin77> <meta http-equiv="X-UA-Compatible" content="IE=edge"/>  
12:07 <gdelhumeau> that you put in the headers via the administration  
12:07 <martin77> thats there... unchanged (ootb)  
12:08 <martin77> and from what i understand this comes from the template vm, right?  
12:08 <martin77> those templates are unchanged too  
12:08 <martin77> so it cant explain the different behaviour imo  
12:09 <Denis> has quit  
12:09 <gdelhumeau> what are the domains on the 2 wikis?  
12:10 <gdelhumeau> actually it is "#set($ok = $response.addHeader("X-UA-Compatible", "IE=XXX"))"  
12:10 <gdelhumeau> actually it is "#set($ok = $response.addHeader("X-UA-Compatible", "IE=Edge"))"  
12:12 <gdelhumeau> the different behaviours can be explained if one of the 2 domains is listed in the "intranet sites" of IE  
12:13 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
12:13 <martin77> yea im trying to find the option for IE to show the zone it put the site in. i thought used to be in the lower right corner in the status bar  
12:18 <mflorea1> has joined #xwiki  
12:18 <martin77> found it. Zone: Local intranet, protected mode: disabled (both)  
12:19 <martin77> so both urls... i just type: xwiki/xwiki  or xwiki-acc/xwiki/  . are both in local intranet, protected mode: disabled  
12:20 <martin77> both are in the same domain / dns zone  
12:20 <martin77> no global names used  
12:20 <martin77> no wins  
12:21 <gdelhumeau> then I don't know  
12:21 <gdelhumeau> but just try to  write #set($ok = $response.addHeader("X-UA-Compatible", "IE=Edge")) just after <meta ...> in htmlheaders.vm  
12:22 <gdelhumeau> maybe it could help  
12:22 <mflorea> has quit  
12:24 <ClemensR> there is a separate setting in the "Extra > Compatibility view" in the IE menu  
12:25 <martin77> there is, but no sites have been added  
12:25 <martin77> its empty  
12:26 <martin77> man this is frustrating :) it feels it cant be THIS tough  
12:26 <martin77> the only difference so far is different subnet  
12:27 <martin77> however i excluded the proxy doing weird stuff with zones maybe.  
12:27 <martin77> verified the zone on both the pages are loaded in  
12:29 <martin77> gdelhumeau. the reason im not willing to accept/try your suggestion to change the .vm template is because it works fine on one of the two servers  
12:29 <martin77> and both files are identical  
12:30 <gdelhumeau> yes sure, it is better to understand  the root cause  
13:08 <vmassol> has quit  
13:17 <martin77> lol  
13:17 <martin77> if i type xwiki/xwiki -> compatibility mode  
13:17 <martin77> if i type xwiki.fq.dn/xwiki -> normal mode  
13:17 <martin77> wtf  
13:27 <Denis> has quit  
13:28 <ClemensR> maybe "display intranet sites in compatibility view" is switched on ?  
13:53 <msmeria> tmortagne: hello  
13:53 <msmeria> fyi there's a horizontal scrollbar when migrating to the latest snapshot: http://s2.postimg.org/7ijvjirl5/scrollbar.png  
13:55 <tmortagne> msmeria: mflorea1 would probably know better what this could mean  
13:55 <tmortagne> or maybe it's caused by flamingo move some way  
13:57 <msmeria> tmortagne: thanks! I'll contact him

14:49 <DarkKnightCZ> Hi, is there an easy way how to create custom event?  
14:53 <DarkKnightCZ> i guess implementing org.xwiki.observation.event.Event is the first part  
14:53 <ClemensR> DarkKnightRZ: I think you can just implement org.xwiki.observation.event.Event  (or FoldeableEvent)  
14:53 <ClemensR> ah, sync :)  
14:53 <DarkKnightCZ> :)  
15:02 <msmeria> has quit  
15:04 <ClemensR> DarkKnightCZ: actually I remember there is some documentation here http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Observation+Module+Local  
15:06 <DarkKnightCZ> ClemensR: yup, just looking at that  
15:07 <Enygma`> Reminder: today is the release for 6.2M2. Please refrain from pushing non-test-fix related commits.  
15:11 <DarkKnightCZ> is there any unique xwiki instance identifier?  
15:15 <DarkKnightCZ> hmm, neverming, i can actually check for remote event
